Fund Purpose: To be used to assist any low income rental city housing program
Sources of Funds: All fee income received by the City for the review and processing of application for low income housing tax credits
Eligible Uses: Processing of private party applications, provide incentives for the construction, acquisition, and rehabilitation of multi-family rental housing for low income households

Fund Name: PEOPLE WHO CARE YOUTH CEN JJDP
Fund Purpose: For the Boys and Girls Club of Venice under the Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Program
Sources of Funds: CA Office of Criminal Justice Planning Grant
Eligible Uses: Establishment of emergency shelters, administrative costs, funding for the Homeless Assistance Program and other related actions

Fund Purpose: Record receipts and disbursements of the federal HUD Healthy Homes Production Program Grant.
Sources of Funds: US Department of Housing and Urban Development Healthy Homes Production Program Grant.
Eligible Uses: For expenditures in accordance with the provisions of the US Department of Housing and Urban Development Office of Healthy Homes and Lead Hazard Control and United States Conference of Mayors

Fund Purpose: Record funds for Homeland Security FY2010 Regional Catastrophic Preparedness Grant Program
Sources of Funds: US Department of Homeland Security Fiscal Year 2010 Regional Catastrophic Preparedness Grant Program award from the California Management Agency.
Eligible Uses: Funds positions in Emergency Management, Fire, Housing, and Police Departments relating to grant implementation

Fund Purpose: Track funds from the US Department of Housing and Urban Development's Lead Hazard Reduction Grant
Sources of Funds: US Department of Housing and Urban Development's Lead Hazard Reduction Demonstration Grant
Eligible Uses: For costs associated with HUD's Lead Hazard Reduction Demonstration Program

Fund Purpose: To implement L.A. Housing Department's lead abatement programs
Sources of Funds: Receipt and disbursement of HUD Lead Gran award for Lead Grant V, VI Lead Outreach Grant II and any future Lead Grant awards.
Eligible Uses: Lead Outreach II used to provide education & outreach service to low-income tenants & homeowners; lead Grant V, VI   used to remediate lead hazards from selected housing units & conduct outreach  & educational activities in highest risk areas.

Fund Purpose: To provide employment counseling and both classroom and on-the-job training for homeless veterans.
Sources of Funds: U.S. Dept. of Labor Grants
Eligible Uses: Salaries, office and administrative expenses, travel, support services, contract expenses

Fund Purpose: Record funds for Homeland Security FY2011 Regional Catastrophic Preparedness Grant Program
Sources of Funds: US Department of Homeland Security Fiscal Year 2011 Regional Catastrophic Preparedness Grant Program award from the California Management Agency.
Eligible Uses: Funds positions in Emergency Management, Fire, Housing, and Police Departments relating to grant implementation

Fund Purpose: Track funds for a grant from the Gas Company to cover costs for a federal energy efficiency grant
Sources of Funds: Southern California Gas Company Grant
Eligible Uses: For continued funding for the Department of Housing's administration costs of federal Energy and Efficiency Conservation Block Grant by the Southern California Gas Company

Fund Purpose: To implement the Homelessness Prevention and Rapid Re-Housing Program
Sources of Funds: U.S. Dept. of Housing and Urban Development Grant
Eligible Uses: Grantees may use the grant for activities relating to the prevention of homelessness and rapid re-housing for homeless individuals and families, including:1) financial assistance, such as short-term and medium-term rental assistance, security and utility deposits, and utility assistance; 2) housing relocation and stabilization services including housing search, mediation, credit repair, moving cost assistance, and case management, 3) Homeless Management Information System(HMIS)costs, and 4) Administrative costs, not to exceed five percent of the grant.

Fund Purpose: Track federal Housing and Urban Development grant funds for Lead Hazard Reduction
Sources of Funds: US Department of Housing and Urban Development Lead Hazard Reduction Demonstration Grant
Eligible Uses: To remediate lead hazard, according to the terms of the grant agreement

Fund Name: LANCER SITE RECREATIONAL IMPROVEMENTS TRUST FUND
Fund Purpose: Record receipts & disbursements from City's Cash pledge Agreement with Libaw-Horowitz Investment
Sources of Funds: Cash pledge Agreement between COLA and Libaw-Horowitz Investment Company
Eligible Uses: To create or make improvements to recreation and park facilities at the Pueblo del Rio housing project and/or for recreational programming at facilities in the vicinity of the former Lancer property at 41st and Alameda street including, but not limited to, the Fred Roberts Park and Ross Snyder Park

Fund Purpose: Tracks CalEMA grant funds to strengthen regional catastrophic preparedness programs
Sources of Funds: FY2009 Homeland Security Regional Catastrophic Preparedness Grant Program from the California Emergency Management Agency
Eligible Uses: For the development of a comprehensive regional reception plan; establishment of a collaborative Regional Disaster Housing Process, creation of a Distribution Plan template, and review of existing emergency plans and a best practices seminar for regional training

Fund Purpose: To fund the senior services program
Sources of Funds: CDBG Grant
Eligible Uses: Aging's Evidence Base Programs, Emergency Alert Response System, and Alternative Housing for seniors.

Fund Purpose: Funding to perform energy efficient retrofits of multifamily affordable housing
Sources of Funds: Energy Efficiency and Conservation Block Grant Funds (EECBG)
Eligible Uses: Funds to be expended in a competitive, performance based bid process for rehabilitation projects

Fund Purpose: To track funds for a HUD grant for Northridge Earthquake housing repairs and recovery projects
Sources of Funds: US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) Community Development Block Grant emergency supplemental funds
Eligible Uses: Earthquake recovery housing costs, especially costs of repair for damaged or abandoned multifamily and condominium projects in the City

Fund Purpose: Implementation of the City's Neighborhood Stabilization Program
Sources of Funds: U.S. Dept. of Housing and Urban Development Grant
Eligible Uses: Used to acquire and rehabilitate foreclosed single family and multi-family properties for affordable homeownership and rental housing opportunities.  The implementation strategy will feature private and public partnerships, including the participation of Enterprise community Partners, a national affordable housing and community development nonprofit organization which has worked with the City for 10 years on similar programs.  The LAHD will also work with its longtime homebuyer partners - mortgage lenders, homebuyer educators and the real estate industry .

Fund Purpose: To track monies arising from HUD's HOME program for low income housing
Sources of Funds: US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) grant for the Rental Rehabilitation Program, and associated loans, fees or penalties
Eligible Uses: Development and new construction hard costs, acquisition  costs, related soft costs,  rehabilitation costs, refinancing costs, community housing development organization costs, relocation costs, and costs relating to payment of loans

Fund Purpose: For development and preservation of affordable housing
Sources of Funds: One-time Council Appropriation, gifts, contributions and interest earnings
Eligible Uses: Exclusively for housing needs of the City including predevelopment activities, acquisition, development, new construction, rehabilitation and restoration

Fund Purpose: To stimulate economic and housing development in impacted areas after the civil unrest.
Sources of Funds: Loan Guarantee from U.S. Dept of Housing and Urban Development
Eligible Uses: Loans to business, purchase, rehab, construction, site improvement/ clearance/demo/relocate, capitalization of Section108 interest cost, micro-enterprise development/ lending related to housing and other physical and economic development under the CDBG program.

Fund Purpose: Record receipts and disbursements for the State's Infill Infrastructure Grant Program.
Sources of Funds: State Housing and Community Development Infill Infrastructure Grant.
Eligible Uses: To fund commitments to 7 projects selected through Round 1 of the 2012 Affordable Housing Trust Fund Notice of Funding Availability

Fund Purpose: Tracks Prop 1C grant funds for affordable housing in the Crenshaw/Mid-City Corridors
Sources of Funds: Crenshaw/Mid-City Corridors Prop 1C Infill Infrastructure Grant
Eligible Uses: To support affordable housing projects in the Crenshaw/Mid-City corridors that are in the process of construction and to provide infrastructure improvements near those projects.

Fund Purpose: To track monies arising from HUD's Rental Rehabilitation Program for low income housing
Sources of Funds: US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) grant for the HOME, and associated loans, fees or penalties
Eligible Uses: Direct costs, indirect costs for subcontractors, and administrative overhead. Unused funds must returned to HUD.

Fund Purpose: Track funds from the US Department of Housing and Urban Development's Lead Hazard Reduction Grant
Sources of Funds: US Department of Housing and Urban Development's Lead Hazard Reduction Demonstration Grant
Eligible Uses: For costs associated with HUD's Lead Hazard Reduction Demonstration Program

Fund Purpose: For the administration of the of Housing Bond Financing Program
Sources of Funds: Monies derived from the sale of revenue bonds for multi-family residential housing developments.
Eligible Uses: For acquiring, developing, constructing and rehabilitating of single family and multi-family residential housing developments; making loans for the financing or refinancing of the acquisition

Fund Purpose: For development of an infill housing methodology and various land use planning activities
Sources of Funds: CA Dept. of Transportation and other grants
Eligible Uses: Grants will be disbursed in compliance with the provisions of each grant program approved.

Fund Purpose: To track housing proceeds from state HCD Department to supplement MacArthur Park Phase A Project
Sources of Funds: Proposition 1C Transit Oriented Development, from State of California Department of Housing and Community Development, and HOME Investment Partnership Program Funds
Eligible Uses: To close a budget shortfall for the MacArthur Park Phase A project

Fund Purpose: To track State Housing and Community development recovery funds for the 2008 Sayre Wildfire
Sources of Funds: Disaster Recovery Initiative Program from the California Department of Housing and Community Development
Eligible Uses: For disaster victims of the 2008 Sayre wildfire and for disaster planning efforts and recovery actions

Fund Purpose: To track receipts and disbursements related to the implementation of Accessible Housing Program to carry out the requirements of Settlement Agreement of US District Court Case CV12-0551.
Sources of Funds: City General Purpose Funds
Eligible Uses: For disbursements related to US District Court Case No. CV 12-0551

Fund Purpose: To provide homeless persons with basic shelter and essential supportive services
Sources of Funds: U.S. Dept of Housing and Urban Development
Eligible Uses: For the payment of certain operating, maintenance and social services expenses in connection with emergency shelters.

Fund Purpose: Used for housing rehabilitation and community development for low and moderate income occupancy
Sources of Funds: Bunker Hill Trust Fund in exchange for Jobs Bill funds to CDD; subsequently all funds were from program income of the housing projects and interest earned from cash balance.
Eligible Uses: Exclusively for the development of low and moderate income rental housing.

Fund Purpose: For the development of low and moderate income rental  housing.
Sources of Funds: Grants, loans, fees, penalties and disbursements
Eligible Uses: Exclusively for the development of low and moderate income rental housing.

Fund Purpose: Supplement job training, provide emergency housing assistance for homeless job training participants
Sources of Funds: Federal Dept. of Labor
Eligible Uses: For job training programs

Fund Purpose: To track funds for the Mortgage Credit Certificate program, and other low-income housing programs
Sources of Funds: Fees from processing of application for mortgage credit certificate
Eligible Uses: Approved operating costs of the Mortgage Credit Certification Program and other moderate-income and low-income housing activities and programs

Fund Name: LOW AND MODERATE INCOME HOUSING FUND
Fund Purpose: Record funds for transition of housing assets of CRA/LA to the LAHD
Sources of Funds: The Los Angeles Community Redevelopment Agency
Eligible Uses: For personnel and related costs to manage the transition of former CRA/LA assets and functions to the Housing Department.

Fund Purpose: To conduct an 18-month study on the connection of housing and HIV, and related actions
Sources of Funds: U.S. Dept. of Housing and Urban Development grant
Eligible Uses: Approved operating costs.

Fund Purpose: To provide affordable housing, and for beach shuttle program in Channel Gateway/Venice
Sources of Funds: Developer contribution for affordable housing
Eligible Uses: For offsite street beautification, implementation of traffic mitigation measures, lighting & landscaping improvement in the Venice area.

Fund Purpose: To provide affordable housing in the Central City West Specific Plan Area
Sources of Funds: Gifts, contributions, housing payments and other monies received for the purpose of the fund
Eligible Uses: Only to be used for the facilitation of affordable housing

Fund Purpose: For the Neighborhood Stabilization Program II (NSP II)
Sources of Funds: U.S. Dept. of Housing and Urban Development Grants
Eligible Uses: Used to acquire and rehabilitate foreclosed single family and multi-family properties for affordable homeownership and rental housing opportunities.  The implementation strategy will feature private and public partnerships, including the participation of Enterprise community Partners, a national affordable housing and community development nonprofit organization which has worked with the City for 10 years on similar programs.  The LAHD will also work with its longtime homebuyer partners - mortgage lenders, homebuyer educators and the real estate industry .

Fund Purpose: For the re-entry employment options demonstration project and related actions
Sources of Funds: CA Dept. of Corrections and Rehabilitation Grant
Eligible Uses: To integrate employment services with the community and faith-based organizations, provide mental health services, transitional housing, family counseling and other services to reduce recidivism

Fund Purpose: To develop housing projects and other services for persons with AIDS
Sources of Funds: US Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)
Eligible Uses: Housing information services(counseling), acquisition, rehabilitation, conversion, lease and repair of facilities, new construction dwelling for single room occupancy, project tenant based rental assistance, short term rent, mortgage, and utility payments

Fund Purpose: Development of viable  communities including  housing for persons with moderate income along with social services
Sources of Funds: American Recovery and Reinvestment Act - Community Development Block Grant
Eligible Uses: Housing, Economic Development, Public Service Projects

Fund Purpose: To stimulate economic and housing development in certain impacted areas
Sources of Funds: Section 108 Loan Program Funds
Eligible Uses: Establishing the improvement district and confirming assessments to be levied upon properties in the district

Fund Purpose: To fund various housing projects
Sources of Funds: State of CA Housing Community Development matching Grant funds
Eligible Uses: Projects should fulfill priority categories of multifamily housing, nine percent low income housing tax credit allocation, HUD section 202 or 811 funding reservations2005 High Leverage Programs (HLP) matching grant funds

Fund Purpose: Track HUD Sustainable Housing grant funds for the Northeast LA Collaborative project
Sources of Funds: US Department of Housing and Urban Development Office of Sustainable Housing and Communities grant
Eligible Uses: For the development and implementation of the Northeast Los Angeles (NELA) Collaborative Project, for Workforce Investment in Boyle Heights/Northeast LA

Fund Purpose: To provide employment services to chronically homeless individuals with mental illness
Sources of Funds: U.S. Dept. of Labor, Office on Disability Employment Police (DOL-ODEP) Grants
Eligible Uses: Finance the implementation of the L.A.'s Hope Chronically Homeless Initiative
